name: Complex
desc: A complex value

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: exp
desc: Compute e^this

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: pow
desc: Compute this^exp

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: Real
desc: Just for the namespacing

name: asinh
desc: Inverse sinh

name: controller
desc:
The main controller for the application.  The controller receives
Operation instances from the view in response to button presses,
and manipulates the Model.

name: BranchingArgOperation
desc: A BranchingOperation that takes an argument, namely B? (bit test)

name: calcDisabled
desc:
Branching operations only perform a calculation when we are running
a program.

name: BranchingOperation
desc:
A program branching operation.  These operations only function when running
a program.  They represent a condition.  If that condition is true, the next
instruction executes normally; otherwise, it is skipped.

name: calcDisabled
desc:
Branching operations only perform a calculation when we are running
a program.

name: Controller
desc:
The main controller for the application.  This abstract class is implemented
by a RealController for normal calculator, and by RunningController,
which manages a running calculator program.

name: argBase
desc: The numeric base for arguments, like register numbers.

name: buttonDown
desc: Handle an operation due to a press on the keyboard.

name: buttonUp
desc:
Finish the operation started by buttonDown.  This is meaningful
for some keys, like SST, show-hex and clear-prefix.

name: getArgsAndRun
desc: Get the arguments described by Arg, and then run it.

name: gotoLineNumberKey
desc:
The key used to GTO an absolute line number ("." on the 16C,
CHS on the 15C).

name: handlePSE
desc:
Handle the pause operation.  Note that this enables stack lift --
see p. 100

name: reset
desc: Reset everything but the state of the state machine

name: showCalculatorError
desc: Show an error on the LCD screen.

name: showMessage
desc: Show a message on the LCD screen.

name: singleStep
desc:
Perform a single step action by running one instruction, and then
returning to an appropriate state (DigitEntry or Running, as
determined by the executed instruction).

name: LetterLabel
desc: One of the 15C's letter keys, from A to E.

name: pressed
desc: What to do when the key is pressed.

name: programListingArgName
desc:
Name for this key as an arg in the program listing, if other than the
default.

name: LimitedOperation
desc:
Operations that do something when the key is pressed, even when the
calculator is in program entry state.  They're called "limited," because
the set of handleXXX() calls is limited to those supported by
ProgramEntry.

name: complexCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in complex mode.

name: floatCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in floating-point mode.

name: intCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in integer mode.

name: pressed
desc: What to do when the key is pressed.

name: arg
desc:
A description of this arguments operation, or ArgDone if there is none.
For example, the STO operation has an argument to indicate which register
to store to.

name: handleOpBeforeCalculate
desc:
Execute the beforeCalculate function of the operation.  Normally it
just executes, but some 15C operations can be deferred; this method
can be overridden to do that.

name: complexCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in complex mode.

name: floatCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in floating-point mode.

name: NormalArgOperation
desc:
An Operation that takes an argument.  For example, the RCL and STO
operations take an argument, giving the register to store to or recall from.

name: arg
desc:
A description of this arguments operation, or ArgDone if there is none.
For example, the STO operation has an argument to indicate which register
to store to.

name: pressed
desc: Do nothing -- we don't know our argument yet.

name: NormalOperation
desc:
A "normal" calculator operation that doesn't take any keyboard arguments.
Generally, they perform some kind of
calculation, or otherwise manipulate the model.

name: complexCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in complex mode.

name: floatCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in floating-point mode.

name: intCalc
desc: The calculation performed when the calculator is in integer mode.

name: pressed
desc: What to do when the key is pressed.

name: NormalOperationOrLetter
desc:
A NormalOperation that doubles as a letter (A-F) on the 15C, as the
argument to LBL, GTO or GSB.  The letters on the 16C are unshifted, so
this doesn't come up there.

name: numericValue
desc:
Give the numeric value of a number key, or one of the 15C's
letters (which are 20..24).
cf. tests.dart, SelfTests.testNumbers().

name: NumberEntry
desc: One of the number keys, from 0 to f.

name: numericValue
desc:
Give the numeric value of a number key, or one of the 15C's
letters (which are 20..24).
cf. tests.dart, SelfTests.testNumbers().

name: pressed
desc: What to do when the key is pressed.

name: Operation
desc:
An operation, triggered by a key on the calculator keyboard, or executed
as part of a program.

name: arg
desc:
A description of this arguments operation, or ArgDone if there is none.
For example, the STO operation has an argument to indicate which register
to store to.

name: calcDisabled
desc:
By default, operations, if present, work for all kinds of controllers,
but cf. BranchingOperation

name: name
desc: Human-readable name for program listing

name: possiblyAlterStackLift
desc:
Either enable or disable stack lift, if appropriate, after this
operation's calculation is done.  This will not be called if this
operation doesn't have a calculation (intCalc or floatCalc on itself,
or on its argument).

name: pressed
desc: What to do when the key is pressed.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: RealController
desc:
A controller for normal calculator operation.  When a program is
running, the real controller continues to exist, for when the program
stops.

name: buttonDown
desc: Handle an operation due to a press on the keyboard.

name: buttonUp
desc:
Finish the operation started by buttonDown.  This is meaningful
for some keys, like SST, show-hex and clear-prefix.

name: getArgsAndRun
desc: Get the arguments described by Arg, and then run it.

name: singleStep
desc:
Perform a single step action by running one instruction, and then
returning to an appropriate state (DigitEntry or Running, as
determined by the executed instruction).

name: RunningController
desc: A controller for when a program is running.

name: argBase
desc: The numeric base for arguments, like register numbers.

name: buttonUp
desc:
Finish the operation started by buttonDown.  This is meaningful
for some keys, like SST, show-hex and clear-prefix.

name: getArgsAndRun
desc: Get the arguments described by Arg, and then run it.

name: gotoLineNumberKey
desc:
The key used to GTO an absolute line number ("." on the 16C,
CHS on the 15C).

name: handlePSE
desc:
Handle the pause operation.  Note that this enables stack lift --
see p. 100

name: showCalculatorError
desc: Show an error on the LCD screen.

name: singleStep
desc:
Perform a single step action by running one instruction, and then
returning to an appropriate state (DigitEntry or Running, as
determined by the executed instruction).

name: SelfTests
desc:
Some built-in regression tests.  There aren't just an excuse to flash
"running" when a user triggers the 16C's self test fonction.  It's also
a way of easily running some of the tests involving integer and floating
point behavior in different browsers. This might be a bit of a pain point
for Dart, since the numeric types behave differently given JavaScript's
deficiencies in ths regard.

name: newController
desc: Create a new controller with its model

name: StackLift
desc:
A declarative description of an Operation's effect on stack lift, when
its calculation has been performed.  This covers the most common effects
that operations can have on stack lift.  See Page 99, "Operations Affecting
Stack Lift" in Appendix B of the 16C's manual.

name: StackLiftEnabledUser
desc:
A type that can be used by states to access the library-private
RealController _stackLiftEnabled flag.  This provides enhanced
encapsulation, by explicitly marking states that do this.

name: stackLiftEnabled
desc:
Tell if stack lift is enabled.  This is considered part of the
controller's state, but note that the status from a running program
reflects back to when a program isn't running.  This is important
for proper functioning of the R/S key, and SST.  The value comes
from the RealController.

name: controller.operations
desc:
The calculator operations.  This is split into its own library so that
it's encapsulated from the controller internals.  Operations are split
into various types, viz:

name: Operations
desc:
The calculator operations.  This is split into its own library so that
it's encapsulated from the controller internals.  This class is just
a collecting place for the static final Operation constants,
and some lists of operations that are useful.

name: special
desc: Operations that can't be stored in memory

name: controller.states
desc:
The states of the controller, reflecting the input mode of the calculator.
There are three main states:  Resting (the state it's usually in,
waiting for something to do), DigitEntry and ProgramEntry.  There
are a large number of additional states, such as argument input,
or running a program.  The full hierarchy looks like this:

name: ActiveState
desc:
Supertype for the two states that process pressed and calculation
functions for NormalOperations.  This is where stack lift
is exposed, because usually stack lift is enabled after performing
a calculation on the model.  It is performed when entering digits,
or recalling a value from a register or lastX.

name: ArgInputState
desc:
Inputting an argument.  Generally, the calculator silently waits for
keypresses giving the argument value.  For example, when recalling
register 1c, the user presses "RCL . c"; the calculator is in this
state while waiting for the ". c" to be pressed.

name: CalculatorOff
desc:
State when the calculator is off.  On desktop and mobile, the calculator
screen is dismissed, but that's awkward on the web, especially if the
calculator is embedded in a page.  So, in the web case, we turn off the
LCD display, and wait in this state to see if the user presses ON at
some point.

name: ControllerState
desc:
Superclass for all states of a Controller.  See the
controller.states library documentation for an overview, including
a diagram.

name: onChangedTo
desc: Called by the controller when this state is changed to

name: unreachable
desc: Convenience method to call from an unreachable operation on a state

name: DigitEntry
desc: The state the calculator's in while entering digits.

name: onArgComplete
desc:
Process an Operation with the argument ArgDone, once the
argument value is available.

name: DoNothing
desc:
State where we ignore keypresses, because the calculator is off or
running self-tests.

name: GosubArgInputState
desc: Inputting the argument for GSB.  See handleGosubEntryDone.

name: handleGosubEntryDone
desc:
When GSB  is pressed (but before it is released), and when we're
not entering a program, we pre-display the first instruction of the
program.  So, Resting.gosubEntryDone calls this method to do that.

name: LimitedState
desc:
Supertype for the three states that process pressed functions
from LimitedOperations (which includes all NormalOperations).
This is the contravariant typing relationship mentioned in our
library overview.  cf. the controller.operations library's class
diagram, notably the dashed subtype line from LimitedOperation
to NormalOperation.

name: onArgComplete
desc:
Process an Operation with the argument ArgDone, once the
argument value is available.

name: MessageShowing
desc: State while a message is showing, like "Error 2."

name: OnOffKeyPressed
desc:
State for after the ON key is pressed, while we're waiting to see if they
pick a special function, or maybe press the ON key again to turn the
calculator off.

name: ProgramEntry
desc: State while entering a program.

name: onArgComplete
desc:
Process an Operation with the argument ArgDone, once the
argument value is available.

name: onChangedTo
desc: Called by the controller when this state is changed to

name: Resting
desc:
The initial state of the calculator, when it's waiting for input telling
it to do something.

name: onArgComplete
desc:
Process an Operation with the argument ArgDone, once the
argument value is available.

name: Running
desc:
State while we're running a program.  While we're in this state, our
Controller stays in Running, but we create a RunningController
that has its own ControllerState.

name: ShowState
desc:
State while we're temporarily showing something, while a button is still
pressed.  For example "f show Hex" lands us in this state.

name: SingleStepping
desc:
State while single-stepping through a program.  Like Running, this state
creates a RunningController that has its own ControllerState.

name: onChangedTo
desc: Called by the controller when this state is changed to

name: WaitingForGotoDot
desc:
State after the GTO key is pressed, when we don't know if the user
will press "." (meaning navigate to a specific line number), or a
label.  In the spirit of Beckett, we do hope one arrives before
too long.

name: WaitingForGotoDotLines
desc:
After "GTO ." is pressed, we're in this state collecting the
three-digit line number.

name: controller
desc:
The state for a calculator instance is held both in the Controller,
and in the Model referenced by the controller.

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: didChangeAppLifecycleState
desc:
Called when the system puts the app in the background or returns
the app to the foreground.

name: dispose
desc: Called when this object is removed from the tree permanently.

name: initState
desc: Called when this object is inserted into the tree.

name: applicationVersion
desc:
package_info doesn't exist for all platforms, so I'm doing it the old
fashioned way.

name: model
desc:
The model for the calculator, centered around Model.  It retains the
state of the calculator, most of which is saved persistently.  It
also functions as a helper to the controller, by providing states
using the state pattern for calculator modes, like the DisplayMode
and the SignMode.  The overall structure looks like this:

name: handleOpBeforeCalculate
desc:
Execute the beforeCalculate function of the operation.  Normally it
just executes, but some 15C operations can be deferred; this method
can be overridden to do that.

name: CalculatorError
desc:
An error that should result in "Error x" being displayed
on the LCD Display

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: DebugLog
desc:
A memento of a calculator state, plus the keystrokes after the state
was captured.  It's meant to be a
tool to facilitate bug reports.

name: DisplayMode
desc:
Display mode and a bit more.  This selects between number base, float versus
integer, and complex versus normal.  The actual code is almost all
concerned with formatting and display, but this is also a convenient place
to select operations based on integer/float/complex mode.

name: convertValuesTo
desc:
Convert values in the model when switching between float and int,
and vice-versa.  We're switching from this mode to next.  The 16C
does interesting things with x and y here.

name: displayName
desc: How this mode is shown on the LCD display

name: float
desc:
digits after the decimal point.  If digits is 10, always
display in scientific notation, as per the 16C manual, page 56.

name: radix
desc: Put calculator in floating-point mode, displaying fractionDigits

name: rightJustify
desc:
Are digits right-justified in this mode?  If not, they'll be
left-justified, like " 1.0       ".

name: select
desc:
Select something based on whether we're in an int mode or a float
mode.

name: signMode
desc:
Give the calculator's effective sign mode, considering the
current display mode (which might be float), and the sign mode
that was last set when the calculator was in integer mode (which
might be now).

name: DisplayModeSelector
desc:
Helper to select something based on whether the calculator's display
mode is one of the int modes, or float mode.  We
use a factory template to pull off dependency inversion between the
model (us) and the controller, for the sake of OO purity.

name: DisplayModel
desc:
A logical model of what's being displayed on the LCD display.
Handles flashing and blinking, and delayed display (like when
clear-prefix is released).

name: displayX
desc:
Display the value of X.
disableWindow applies to the first display of X.  If there's a delayed
value, it reverts to disableWindow being false.

name: DoubleWordStatus
desc:
An object for helping with the "double" integer functions, double multiply,
double divide and double remainder

name: formatMantissaU
desc:
Format the unsigned part of the mantissa to the given number of digits.
Result will be either digits or digits+1 characters long.

name: formatScientific
desc:
Format in scientific format, as modified by the
(potentially overridden) constrainExponent function.

name: convertValuesTo
desc:
Convert values in the model when switching between float and int,
and vice-versa.  We're switching from this mode to next.  The 16C
does interesting things with x and y here.

name: rightJustify
desc:
Are digits right-justified in this mode?  If not, they'll be
left-justified, like " 1.0       ".

name: select
desc:
Select something based on whether we're in an int mode or a float
mode.

name: signMode
desc:
Give the calculator's effective sign mode, considering the
current display mode (which might be float), and the sign mode
that was last set when the calculator was in integer mode (which
might be now).

name: increment
statusText
desc: Text for the annunciator on the LCD display, if we're showing it.

name: toBigInt
desc:
Interpret v as an integer according to the sign mode and the model's
word size, and return the result as a BigInt.

name: valueToLabel
desc:
Translate value to an int that could be a label, without any range
checks to see if it's a valid label.  Always returns a non-negative int.

name: LcdContents
desc: A comparable data holder for the contents of what is displayed on the LCD

name: sign
desc: For self test

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: MKey
desc:
The model's view of a key on the keyboard.  The model needs to know where
ProgramOperations are on the portrait layout of the keyboard, because
they are displayed on the LCD display as row-column numbers.

name: Memory
desc:
The calculator's internal memory that holds registers and
programs.

name: initializeSystem
desc:
Called by our controller, which necessarily happens after the Model
exists.

name: programNybbles
desc: Amount of memory taken up by program

name: totalNybbles
desc: Total number of nybbles of storage

name: MemoryPolicy
desc: Controls the policy around memory allocation

name: checkExtendProgramMemory
desc:
Throws CalculatorError(4) if there's no room to add seven bytes
of program memory.

name: checkRegisterAccess
desc: Throws a CalculatorError(3) if the given register does not exist.

name: showMemory
desc: Give the string displayed by the MEM key

name: Model
desc:
Our model, the main entry point to this module.  See the library-level
documentation for a description, and an explanation of the model's
structure.  Extended by Model15 and Model16.

name: captureDebugLog
desc:
Starts or stops capturing debug log information.  A debug log captures
the calculator state, and subsequent keystrokes.  It's meant to be a
tool to facilitate bug reports.

name: chsX
desc:
Negate the value in x like the CHS key does.  The behavior varies
according to the current sign mode.  In complex mode, it leaves the
imaginary part alone.

name: compare
desc: Compare two values according to the current sign mode

name: decodeJson
desc:
Convert from a data structure that comes from JSON.  If there's an
error in the middle, it might be partially read, but not in a way
that causes bad behavior in the calculator.

name: doubleWordStatus
desc:
Gives a helper object for implementation of the double-integer multiply,
remainder and divide operations.

name: floatOverflow
desc:
The float overflow flag, which is stored as gFlag on the 16C.  On the 15C,
it causes errorFlash to be true.

name: isZero
logicalKeys
desc:
The list of "logical" keys.  This has nothing to do with the UI;
The order of the operations in this list determines the
externalized form of the operations in the calculator's storage
(the opcodes).  It also determines the displayed appearance of
operations in program mode, whether the calculator is in portrait or
landscape orientation.

name: modelName
desc: The name of this model of the calculator (16C or 15C).

name: newProgramInstruction
desc: Create an instance of the model-specific ProgramInstruction subtype

name: popSetResultX
desc: Pop the stack and set X, setting lastX

name: popSetResultXC
desc: Pop the stack and set X from a Dart double, setting lastX

name: popSetResultXF
desc: Pop the stack and set X from a Dart double, setting lastX

name: popSetResultXI
desc: Pop the stack and set X from a signed BigInt, setting lastX

name: pushStack
desc: "lift" stack, after which one can write to x

name: registerNumberBase
desc: Are register numbers base 10 (15C), or base 16 (16C)?

name: reset
desc: Reset the calculator to its default state.

name: resultX
desc: Set a result in X, which saves the old X value in lastX

name: rotateStackDown
desc: the R key

name: rotateStackUp
desc: The R key

name: toJson
desc: Convert to a data structure that can be serialized as JSON.

name: tryParseValue
desc:
Try to parse s consistent with the current display mode, giving a
Value on success.

name: wordSize
desc:
Set the word size, and fix up the values on the stack for the new
size.  A size of 0 is interpreted as 64, as per the 16C.

name: xC
desc: Get x as a complex value

name: xF
desc: Get x as a Dart double

name: xI
desc: Get x as a signed BigInt

name: xImaginary
desc: Just the imaginary part of x

name: NumStatus
desc:
A bit of interface segregation:  A reduced API of just the stuff
int operations need from the model.  This comes in handy for the
double operations, and for dealing with the I register.  I is always
68 bits long, regardless of the calculator's current word size.

name: NumStatus68
desc:
A helper for the index register, which is always stored as a 68 bit
quantity, regardless of the calculator mode.

name: Observable
desc:
A pretty bog-standard observable.  Odd that Dart doesn't have one in
the core library.

name: OperationMap
desc:
A representation of all of the operations.  This is used by the model
to assign op codes and labels to ProgramOperations.

name: shortcuts
desc: Key entry shortcuts, like how on the 16C, I is RCL-I and (i) is RCL-(i)

name: special
desc: Operations that can't be stored in the calculator's memory

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: ProgramInstruction
desc:
An instruction in a program, consisting of a ProgramOperation and
a keyboard argument value.

name: programDisplay
desc: How this is displayed in the LCD

name: programListing
desc: How this is displayed in a program listing

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: ProgramListener
desc:
A listener that receives callbacks when a program delivers results
to the user.  This is used for testing.

name: onDone
desc: Called when the program finishes normally, via a RTN instruction.

name: onError
desc: Called when the program stops due to a CalculatorError

name: onErrorShown
desc:
Called at the moment a calculator error is shown, whether a program is
running or not.  If a program is running, this should be followed by
onError().

name: onPause
desc:
Called when a PSE instruction momentarily pauses the program to
display results.

name: onRS
desc:
Called when an R/S instruction stops the program (usually in the
middle, to deliver intermediate results).

name: onStop
desc: Called when the program is stopped due to a keypress

name: resumeFromPause
desc:
A future that completes when we should resume from a pause instruction,
after onPause() is called.

name: ProgramMemory
desc:
A representation of the calculator's 406 nybble data store as a list
of program instructions.  ProgramMemory takes over space from register
storage as needed.  We also keep the return stack for GSB instructions
here, and the current program line.

name: operator []
desc: line counts from 1

name: decodeJson
desc:
Must be called after the register storage has been read in, so any
stray data will be properly zeroed out.

name: handleRunStopKepyress
desc:
A RunStop keypress can resume a program, in which case the return stack
shoould be left undisturbed.  It can also start a "new" program run,
so we need to be sure the return stack isn't in underflow

name: incrementCurrentLine
desc:
Increment the current line, up to a max of lines, wrapping to 0.
To be clear, there are lines+1 possible values.

name: insert
desc: Insert a new instruction, and increment currentLine to refer to it.

name: lines
desc: Number of lines in the program

name: programListener
desc:
This is a testing hook; tests can override this to tweak behaviors
and detect events.

name: ProgramOperation
desc:
The model's view of an operation.  This is extended by the controller's
Operation class.  The parts of Operation that are relevant to the model
are lifted into the model class ProgramOperation so that Model doesn't
depend on a controller class.  Model is parameterized by ProgramOperation
so that the controller can refer to members of Operation that are logically
part of the controller.

name: name
desc: Human-readable name for program listing

name: numericValue
desc:
Give the numeric value of a number key, or one of the 15C's
letters (which are 20..24).
cf. tests.dart, SelfTests.testNumbers().

name: programListingArgName
desc:
Name for this key as an arg in the program listing, if other than the
default.

name: rcName
desc: The row/column "name", which for digits looks like " 1".

name: Registers
desc:
A representation of the available memory as registers.  "Available memory"
is what's left over of the 406 nybble data store after the program's
storage is deducted.

name: incrementI
desc: Gives value after increment

name: Settings
desc: User settings that control the calculator's appearance or behavior

name: decodeJson
desc:
Convert from a data structure that comes from JSON.  If there's an
error in the middle, it might be partially read, but not in a way
that causes bad behavior in the calculator.

name: euroComma
desc:
Should we show numbers Euro-style, with commas instead of periods
and vice-versa?

name: hideComplement
desc: Should we hide the complement annunciator?

name: isMobilePlatform
desc:
Not really a setting, but we need it in the same places:  Is it possible
to set the screen orientation on this device?  It is iff we're a native
mobile app.

name: msPerInstruction
desc:
How long do we want an instruction to take when running a program?
Note that number keys run about 5x faster than this.

name: showWordSize
desc: Should we show the word size annunciator on the display?

name: toJson
desc: Convert to a data structure that can be serialized as JSON.

name: traceProgramToStdout
desc:
When running a program, should a program trace be sent to stdout?  This
can only be set by importing a JSON file, on the theory that people
who can get at stdout are also comfortable hacking a JSON file, and
trying to explain "stdout" in a settings menu is hard.

name: windowEnabled
desc:
Should the window functions be enabled?  If not, we just shrink the
digits when a number is too big.

name: ShiftKey
desc: The state of which shift key was last pressed, if any.

name: select
desc:
Select the appropriate member from a selectable ShiftKeySelected
based on the Model's shift status.

name: ShiftKeySelected
desc:
Superclass for things that can be selected based on whether the f or
g key, or neither, has been pressed.  See ShiftKey.select.  It's a
little like the Visitor pattern - a tyepsafe way of avoiding a switch
statement on the shift key.

name: increment
valueToLabel
desc:
Translate value to an int that could be a label, without any range
checks to see if it's a valid label.  Always returns a non-negative int.

name: Value
desc: Immutable calculator value

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: asDouble
desc:
Interpret this value as a floating point, and convert to a double.
There is no corresponding asInt method, because the int interpretation
depends on the bit size and the sign mode - cf. IntegerSignMode.toBigInt()

name: asMatrix
desc: If this is a matrix descriptor, give the matrix number, where A is 0.

name: exponent
desc:
Get the exponent part of this value interpreted as a float.
Not valid for infinity or -infinity.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: internal
desc:
The calculator's internal representation of a value, as an unsigned
integer of (up to) 64 bits in normal operation (128 for the double
integer operations).  It's a BigInt rather than an int because
Javascript Is Evil (tm).  That said, it does let us handle the double
integer operations easily.

name: isZero
desc:
Determine if this value is zero.  In 1's complement mode,
-0 isZero, too.

name: mantissaDigit
desc:
Give one digit of the mantissa, where 0 is the MSD, and 9 is the LSD.
-1 gives the carry digit (9 is negative, 0 is positive).

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: zero
desc: Zero for both floats and ints

name: view.back_panel
desc: The back panel of the calculator.

name: BPTable
desc: A table on the back panel that scales with the screen size.

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: paint
desc:
Called whenever the object needs to paint. The given Canvas has its
coordinate space configured such that the origin is at the top left of the
box. The area of the box is the size of the size argument.

name: shouldRepaint
desc:
Called whenever a new instance of the custom painter delegate class is
provided to the RenderCustomPaint object, or any time that a new
CustomPaint object is created with a new instance of the custom painter
delegate class (which amounts to the same thing, because the latter is
implemented in terms of the former).

name: view.buttons
desc:
Buttons for the keyboard.  When pressed, buttons consult the Model to see
if a shift key has been pressed, and dispatch an appropriate
Operation to the Controller.

name: ButtonFactory
desc: A helper to create the buttons and their associated layout.

name: ButtonLayout
desc: The layout of the buttons.

name: CalculatorBlueSqrtButton
desc:
The 16C's square root button, which draws an extra line above the blue
label to visually complete the square-root symbol.  Lining this
up depends on the specific font, which is bundled with the app.

name: CalculatorButton
desc:
A button on the calculator keyboard.  CalculatorButton uses a
Flutter CustomPaint with a painter that delegates back to the
CalculatorButton's paintForPainter method.  This is a template
method that uses the various drawXXX() methods and the getters defined
here to draw a button.  The defaults provided here work for most buttons,
but are specialized for buttons that have a distinct visual appearance.

name: acceleratorKey
desc: Key (or keys) to generate a press of this button

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: didUpdateWidget
desc: Called whenever the widget configuration changes.

name: dispose
desc: Called when this object is removed from the tree permanently.

name: initState
desc: Called when this object is inserted into the tree.

name: keyPressed
desc: When the button is "pressed" with an accelerator key

name: keyReleased
desc: When the button is released with an accelerator key

name: CalculatorButtonWithLJ
desc:
The button that has LJ in blue text.  Deja vu Sans has a really ugly "J",
so we change the font.

name: CalculatorEnterButton
desc: The enter button, which occupies two rows on the keyboard.

name: CalculatorFButton
desc: The f shift button, which is gold instead of black.

name: CalculatorGButton
desc: The g shift button, which is blue instead of black.

name: CalculatorOnButton
desc:
The on/off button, which is flat on the 16C.
This button also has a special function when the on button is pressed,
because pressing it a second time turns the calculator off, so
it's also a CalculatorOnSpecialButton.

name: CalculatorOnSpecialButton
desc:
A CalculatorButton that has a special function when used with conjunction
with the on'off button.  Such buttons show text describing their special
function when the on/off button has been pressed.

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: CalculatorWhiteSqrtButton
desc:
The 15C's square root button, which draws an extra line above the blue
label to visually complete the square-root symbol.  Lining this
up depends on the specific font, which is bundled with the app.

name: UpperLabel
desc: The gold label above some groups of keys

name: paint
desc:
Called whenever the object needs to paint. The given Canvas has its
coordinate space configured such that the origin is at the top left of the
box. The area of the box is the size of the size argument.

name: shouldRepaint
desc:
Called whenever a new instance of the custom painter delegate class is
provided to the RenderCustomPaint object, or any time that a new
CustomPaint object is created with a new instance of the custom painter
delegate class (which amounts to the same thing, because the latter is
implemented in terms of the former).

name: view.lcd_display
desc:
Widget to draw the LCD Display, using a CustomPainter and
direct drawing commands.  The main eleven-digit display doesn't
use a font; the individual segments are drawn.

name: Digit
desc: Draw a digit, by drawing the individual Segments.

name: LcdDisplay
desc:
A widget that looks like an LCD display.  It uses Flutter's CustomPainter
to directly draw the visual elements, notably using 7-segment Digit
instances.  LcdDisplay listens to events from Model.display.

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: Segments
desc:
Singleton to do the math of where tho display the digit segments.
These segments are based on a 72-pixel high digit whose upper-left hand
corner is at 0,0.  it is expected that the client will scale and translate
the Canvas accordingly.

name: commaTail
desc: Add this to decimalPoint

name: width
desc: The width of a segment, including space on the right

name: view.main_screen
desc:
The main screen of the calculator.  It uses ScreenPositioner to
exactly position widgets, and scale them to the screen size.

name: DrawnBackground
desc: Draw the background of the calculator.

name: paint
desc:
Called whenever the object needs to paint. The given Canvas has its
coordinate space configured such that the origin is at the top left of the
box. The area of the box is the size of the size argument.

name: shouldRepaint
desc:
Called whenever a new instance of the custom painter delegate class is
provided to the RenderCustomPaint object, or any time that a new
CustomPaint object is created with a new instance of the custom painter
delegate class (which amounts to the same thing, because the latter is
implemented in terms of the former).

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: MainMenu
desc: The application's main menu.

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: MainScreen
desc:
The main screen.  Most of the interesting work happens in
LcdDisplay and CalculatorButton.

name: deadZoneColor
desc: Midnight blue for area outside of calculator UI

name: keyFrameSilver
desc: Silver frame around the keys keys

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: ScreenPositioner
desc:
A utility to to position something in absolute positions on the screen,
relative to the calculator face in virtual centimeters, which correspond
to the real HP-16c.  This encloses a child widget within a suitable
container to be put inside Stack widget with StackFit.expand set.

name: box
desc: x, y, w and h are in cm
